net.sourceforge.gjtapi.raw
Interface JccTpi

All Known Subinterfaces:
TelephonyProvider
public interface JccTpi

This includes all methods that are required by any Jcc implementation. AttachMedia() and beep() are ignored if JccTpi is implemented. GetAddressType and getDialledDigits() returns null. SetLoadControl() will MethodNotSupportedException. Creation date: (2000-10-04 13:59:27)

setLoadControl

public void setLoadControl(java.lang.String startAddr,
                           java.lang.String endAddr,
                           double duration,
                           double admissionRate,
                           double interval,
                           int[] treatment)
                    throws javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException
This method imposes or removes load control on calls made to the specified addresses. The implementation can throw the MethodNotSupportedException if the platform does not support the load control functionality. Note that a policy object may be designed to define the policy to be implemented by the platform as a result of this method instead of defining the policy through the given parameters. This might be designed in the future specifications.

Note that currently the Jcc specification does not define "treatment". Creation date: (2000-11-10 12:26:54)

Parameters:
startAddr - the lower address of the range
endAddr - the upper address of the range, or null if we are specifying a single address
duration - specifies the duration in milliseconds for which the load control should be set. Duration of 0 indicates that the load control should be removed. Duration of -1 indicates an infinite duration (i.e until disabled by the application). Duration of -2 indicates network default duration.
admissionRate - the call admission rate of the call load control mechanism used.
interval - the type of call load control mechanism to use, the interval (in milliseconds) between calls that are admitted.
treatment - specifies the treatment of the calls that are not admitted.The contents of this parameter are ignored if the load control duration is set to zero.
Throws:
javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException - The exception description.
